website_summaries.verdict: Packing 2,500 rpm and a 6 A motor into a drill that weighs just 3.1 pounds, this is a powerful addition to a home workbench. The ability to add a side handle for added control is a nice plus for a sub-$50 drill.
pros: Corded drill with a 6 A motor and 2,500 rpm
Variable-speed dial is built into the switch
Designed with mods in mind, specifically an optional hook or side handle
4 drill bits included along with a case
cons: The keyless chuck tends to grip less tightly over time, requiring replacement
Reverse setting is a bit clunky

customer_reviews.title: This isn't a Metabo. It's a Hitachi. Made In China.
customer_reviews.text: Rip Off. This is NOT a German Metabo. It's a Chinese product equivalent to a $9.95 Harbor Freight VSR drill motor. Save your money. 'Metabo HST' is an Asian holding company that bought out Hitachi and they contracted the Chinese to build this faux Metabo drill. I have no idea how they get away with using the Metabo registered trade mark other than by adding the 'HST' to the name. Deceptive marketing and a scam. Headed right back to Amazon with a nasty gram attached.
customer_reviews.author: CampyBob

customer_reviews.title: Great handy drill!
customer_reviews.text: I am a petite woman that likes to do handy stuff around the house. We used to own a cordless B&D drill but it always ran out of power and eventually stopped charging after not much use. After being scarred by that experience we decided to get a corded drill instead. I love using this drill and have already done several projects using it. It is very easy to use even for a relative beginner like myself and the power is excellent. The trigger is responsive and easy to control speed with, and the reverse feature is useful. The build of the drill feels very solid while being relatively compact. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Janet K.

customer_reviews.title: Where to start
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a burned-out 25-year-old 3/8 Skill drill I had been using off and on for years, but daily for the last few months rebuilding my deck. This lasted three screws before it started smoking. It made the crunchy noise my old skill drill made when it started to go- almost immediately. It is quite heavy and doesn't have the same smooth function as my much lighter skill drill. Aside from the weight, it runs very hot on the outside after only a few screws. I do follow the recommended use, so it is not from not knowing how to use a drill.
customer_reviews.author: sherm62

customer_reviews.title: Speed control doesn't always work.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drill because it said it had spped control but it is pretty sketchy. I set it for it's lowest setting and it will work for a few seconds and then speeds up. It does this over and over again and it's frustrating. It's okay but I wouldn't highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: K. South

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drill for price
customer_reviews.text: I needed a lightweight electric reversible drill to secure and remove fence screws. It works well and is easy to use. Ability to screw in 4 1/2 screws into hard wood with minimum effort. Drill will run all day with ease with cord. Battery drills were wimpy and ran out of energy very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: G. Hasty

customer_reviews.title: Reliability
customer_reviews.text: I like the power of the corded drill, the price and the warranty. I originally sought a comparable Hitachi until my battery operated Hitacchi would not hold the drill in the chuck when backing ours a drill.
customer_reviews.author: KenWG

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Bargain on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant about this drill because of the Metabo/Hitachi thing. I heard that Hitachi tools were bought by a Chinese conglomerate and the quality had gone way down--and I actually thought I'd cancelled the order but it showed up and I am 100% impressed. As good or better than a $200 Milwaukee, seriously. Will it last? I dunno but I've already dropped it three times and it's still dead on perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Gillette

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: It’s not light but works great. Too bad I don’t need it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Ken M.

customer_reviews.title: Compact strong smooth an easy to handle on thin guages
customer_reviews.text: This was ordered same day I used it the next day yet was such a pleasure to catch up on approximately over 150 5/16 holes thru 18 gauge varying to 16 plus under a truck between cab and frame less than a foot Done and like a Rosey the riviter and a baseball fanatic which I'm not. Huuum baby. Hitachi is my fabrication choice across the board.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than older model Hitachi
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to replace an older model Hitachi that was stolen. So I liked it so well that I bought it again. The keyless chuck is solid and easy to use. I liked the high speed since I use it often with a wire brush. Lots of power. I would have given it 5 stars except for the cord, which is stiff.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Hard to find lockable variable speed drill.
customer_reviews.text: You can actually adjust drill speed with knob while it's running. very cool. I'm kind of using it as a lathe.
customer_reviews.author: gwalk

customer_reviews.title: Strong - medium sized drill
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be very well made. Runs well & has lots of torque.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gollmer

customer_reviews.title: bad review because came defective
customer_reviews.text: when I turned it on I noticed some suspicious smell (not strong but reminiscent of electrical burn or something like that) and it makes more noise than it should - probably a problem with one of the bearing (even my old one much quiet), so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: alex2g9

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drill/driver at great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a superb product. It performs a bit better than expected. It is rugged and powerful. I used it as a pilot drill and screw driver for 3 inch wood screws. It worked like a champ. Often i needed no pilot hole because of is power. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Butts

customer_reviews.title: Great Drill!
customer_reviews.text: My garbage Black and Decker drill failed so I bought this one. The speed control works well, and it is very powerful with high torque. The all metal chuck grips well. For drilling larger holes, I recommend purchasing the side handle accessory.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. David J. Liu

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use works perfectly. A standard drill at a good price. What else could you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Galler

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be very good quality
customer_reviews.text: Heavy...seems to be made of quality materials. Variable speed works better than any drill I have ever owned. Highly recommend. Would give it 5 stars if it were not so heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Chauncey

customer_reviews.title: Used for my DIY Detergent, Excellent Price!
customer_reviews.text: I brought this to use for my DIY detergent and it work with almost every size drill because it can be turned to fit.
customer_reviews.author: Coach P

customer_reviews.title: Quality and price
customer_reviews.text: I love my new toy, yeah I live my tools. This drill I love it doesn't need a key for tightning and losening. Seems to be a very good drill.
customer_reviews.author: SunshineLady11

customer_reviews.title: Terrific drill
customer_reviews.text: Like the drill. I drilled threw some oak timbers did a good job. Would recommend it to everybody.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great drill!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves his new drill. He is very picking and searched for a long time to find a replacement for his old drill. He is very happy with this choice.
customer_reviews.author: arkies

customer_reviews.title: Great drill
customer_reviews.text: This drill works great. Very light weight and good torque. Recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: David Jacoby Jr

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: It is poorly made, under powered, does not hold bits straight, and not worth ten percent of what I paid.
customer_reviews.author: William M. Hewitt

customer_reviews.title: Struck out!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to pre-drill for screws to enable me to put feet on a free standing cabinet. I had great difficulty drilling for both the feet and cabinet. This drill just plain struck out as a driver. I ended up having to use a Phillips screwdriver and do it myself! Not at all what I bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: beetime

customer_reviews.title: It spins
customer_reviews.text: It spins fast and hard. What more can you ask?
customer_reviews.author: Elektrodread

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: It's a cheap drill, don't expect to get heavy duty use out of it.. Bought because I kept burning out cordless batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Lehrer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: No complaints here. It gets the job done. Brought it for my husband and he used it to build a deck.
customer_reviews.author: Micole Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for home improvement projects!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this metabo corded drill to replace an older yet similar hitachi drill that I had gotten my money’s worth from! This is a great upgrade! It meets all my expectations, for home improvement! I just wish it had come with a case! Luckily it fits in my old hitachi case for storage!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Harris

customer_reviews.title: Good, but no extra carbon brushes.
customer_reviews.text: Good product, but it didn't come with extra graphite brushes which was disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Amro Algamdi

customer_reviews.title: Forget it
customer_reviews.text: Defective item. Sent email that motor had a rattle noise like a marble roll around. No response from supplier. Since the cost was minimal, I have not pursued remedy. Would advise against purchase.
customer_reviews.author: myron wotring

customer_reviews.title: Best small corded drill I could find
customer_reviews.text: It's a little bit difficult to maneuver it into really slow speeds, but other than that it's great. It's so difficult to find good, small corded drills. Not really interested in cordless drill that have less power, are bulkier and develop battery problems
customer_reviews.author: Stephen R. Swofford

customer_reviews.title: I liked the drill but then the Chuck came loose.
customer_reviews.text: Chuck came loose. No response from svcsupport@metabousa.com. Only had for 2 months. It looks like the screw inside the chuck was missing. Would have been a 5 star if they responded and fixed the drill.
customer_reviews.author: Will S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a great price
customer_reviews.text: The Hubs loved this. He said it was a great product for an amazing price... and he used to work for a tool manufacturer!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: Very powerfull, and easy to handle.
customer_reviews.text: I like the power this drill has. Although a little on the heavy side, it is easy to handle. I would recommend this drill to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: SAL  BARRANTI

customer_reviews.title: Chuck would not stay secured
customer_reviews.text: Great for forward speed drilling, but when used for removing deck screws, as soon as it had resistance, the chuck would loosen and the screw driver would fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Old Ben

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Great drill I buy it to make a drain hole on my back yard lest then 7 minutes no problem
customer_reviews.author: Narciso Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The drill is lightweight, easy to operate, and performs efficiency. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: michael mandel

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, drilled through carbon drill once I had the proper bits
customer_reviews.author: carmen puccio

customer_reviews.title: As good as a Dewalt
customer_reviews.text: I like that it had the power to sink 3inch many deck screws with no problems, and the price.
customer_reviews.author: Edward R Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Functions properly
customer_reviews.text: Heavier than other dewalt drill I currently own, works great otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Roger C

customer_reviews.title: Compare to Dewalt & other big Hitters
customer_reviews.text: Overall very pleased ! Well Balanced plenty of power and I like the high rpms
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Metabo drill
customer_reviews.text: Thank you I received my tool (Metabo drill), tested and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Chinguile -Tanzania

product_meta.title: Metabo HPT Drill, Corded, 7-Amp, 3/8-Inch, Metal Keyless Chuck, Variable Speed w/ Dial, Rubber Over-Molded Handle, Forward / Reverse, Belt Hook, 5-Year Warranty (D10VH2)
product_meta.description: The D10VH2 0-2700 RPM 3/8" Drill featuring an all-metal keyless chuck for higher durability and better bit holding capability. It is designed to drill into various types of metal, wood, plastic resin, stainless steel and similar materials. This model also tightens and loosens small screws, wood screws, nuts and bolts.
feature_bullets: Same tools. New name. Hitachi Power Tools has renamed to Metabo HPT
Powerful 7-Amp motor, forcible power combines high speed with optimal torque
Max torque of 133. 7 in-lbs good for high speed applications
All metal 3/8" keyless chuck for greater durability and better bit holding ability
Form fit palm grip with rubber over-molded handle designed to comfortably fit in hand for improved control with minimal vibration
Variable speed trigger with dial for precise operation
Trigger lock-on is convenient for reducing fatigue during continuous use operation
Easy to access forward/reverse button makes backing out a bit quick and easy, and can be operated with one hand

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars151 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
